# Vendor Service Requirements

## 1. Introduction
The Vendor Service is responsible for managing vendor accounts, catalogs, quotations, deliveries, invoices, and performance reports. It serves as the primary interface for vendors to interact with the e-Procurement system.

## 2. Core Entities

| Entity | Description |
| :--- | :--- |
| **VendorAccount** | Manages vendor identity, profile, and status (verified, active, blacklisted). |
| **VendorCatalogItem** | Items (Goods/Services) offered by the vendor. Includes pricing, specifications, and stock status. |
| **RFQ (Request For Quotation)** | Requests sent to vendors to bid on specific procurement items. |
| **QuotationResponse** | The vendor's response to an RFQ, including price, lead time, and notes. |
| **Purchase Order (PO)** | Official order document sent to the vendor. |
| **Delivery** | Tracks the shipment of goods from vendor to company. |
| **Invoice** | Billing document generated by the vendor (or system) based on POs or milestones. |
| **VendorEvaluation** | Performance metrics and scores for the vendor based on delivery quality and timeliness. |

## 3. Functional Requirements

### 3.1 Vendor Management
- **Registration & Profile**: Vendors must be able to register and update their profiles.
- **Verification**: New vendors must go through a verification process (handled by Admin/Auth services, reflected here).
- **Dashboard**: Vendors need a dashboard to see active RFQs, POs, and performance stats.

### 3.2 Catalog Management
- **CRUD Operations**: Vendors can add, update, deletion (soft delete), and view catalog items.
- **Mass Update**: Capability to update multiple items at once (e.g., price changes).
- **Variations**: Support for item variations (size, color, etc.).

### 3.3 RFQ & Quotation
- **View RFQs**: Vendors can view "Open" RFQs assigned to them.
- **Submit Quotation**: Vendors can submit prices and lead times.
- **Clarification**: Vendors can ask questions regarding an RFQ.
- **Decline**: Vendors can decline to bid on an RFQ.

### 3.4 Order Fulfillment (Delivery)
- **Delivery Scheduling**: Vendors can create delivery schedules for approved POs.
- **Packing List**: Vendors must upload packing lists for shipments.
- **Proof of Delivery (POD)**: Vendors (or system/logistics) can upload PODs to confirm receipt.

### 3.5 Invoicing
- **Generate Invoice**: System can auto-generate draft invoices based on POs.
- **Upload Documents**: Vendors can attach tax documents or official invoices.
- **Submit for Payment**: Vendors submit invoices to Finance for processing.

### 3.6 Reporting
- **Performance Report**: Vendors can view their own performance metrics (On-time rate, Defect rate).
- **Export**: Ability to export reports to PDF/Excel.

## 4. Non-Functional Requirements
- **Security**: All endpoints must be secured (Role-Based Access Control).
- **Audit**: All critical actions (submission, updates) must be audited.
- **Integration**: Must integrate with Logistics Service (dummy) for tracking.
- **Availability**: High availability for vendor portal access.
